Basic Syntax and Data Types.Java Syntax: Java programs are typically organized into classes and methods. A class contains the program's code, and methods define the behavior of the program.
Data Types: int: Represents integers. Example: int age = 30;
double: Represents floating-point numbers. Example: double price = 19.99;
char: Represents a single character. Example: char grade = 'A';
boolean: Represents true or false values. Example: boolean isJavaFun = true;
String: Represents a sequence of characters. Example: String greeting = "Hello, Java!";

Variables.Definition: Variables are used to store data in Java programs.
Variables.Example: int x = 10; // Declare and initialize an integer variable 'x' with the value 10.
